title: Even people who bought Meta’s Ray-Ban smart glasses don’t want to use them
description: That's not stopping Meta from making second-gen Stories, WSJ report claims.

title: iPhone sales are down, but Apple’s subscriptions are growing fast
description: Services and wearables were bright spots in an otherwise relatively slow quarter.

title: Waymo will expand rideshares to Austin, Texas, its fourth city
description: Waymo say testers will be taking rides "this fall."

title: Linux surpasses the Mac among Steam gamers
description: It's not the year of Linux on desktop; it's the year of Linux on a handheld.

title: FCC slaps $300M fine on “largest illegal robocall operation” it’s ever seen
description: Robocallers were already banned for life and unable to pay previous fines.

title: Backblaze probes increased annualized failure rate for its 240,940 HDDs
description: Lifetime AFRs grew, while quarterly AFRs went from 1.54% in Q1 to 2.28% in Q2.

title: General Motors drops entry-level Blazer EV as deliveries begin
description: It's yet another example of new EVs getting more and more expensive.

title: Angry Tesla customers sue firm over “grossly” exaggerated EV range
description: Three Tesla drivers launch class action, alleging fraud and false advertising.

title: Qualcomm chip sales down 25 percent, plans layoffs
description: Qualcomm doesn't expect a recovery next quarter, either.

title: Musk calls French news agency’s copyright case against X “bizarre”
description: France has required online platforms to pay for news since 2019.

title: Satellite operators poised for $9 billion payday after clearing C-band spectrum
description: Intelsat, SES are on track to get nearly $9 billion in FCC incentive payments.

title: Microsoft accidentally leaks internal utility for testing new Windows 11 features
description: StagingTool is a lot like a widely used third-party utility called ViVeTool.

title: Baldur’s Gate 3 early impressions: You’ll spend whole weeks in here and love it
description: Another remarkable feat of a streamlined tabletop experience by Larian Studios.

title: This bioelectronic device lets scientists map electrical signals of the Venus flytrap
description: The signals spread radially outward with no clear preferred direction.

title: How cities can stem the tide of pedestrian deaths from large cars and SUVs
description: Ever-larger cars and trucks are causing a safety crisis on US streets.
